summary: Dependency security vulnerability in got-10.7.0 library (CVE-2022-33987) that allows redirects to UNIX sockets. The issue was automatically resolved by Mend when the vulnerable library was removed from the project inventory.
userImpact: Users of the SDK could be exposed to potential integrity attacks through malicious redirects to UNIX sockets if using the vulnerable got library version.
rootCause: got library version 10.7.0 lacked validation for UNIX socket redirects in HTTP requests
proposedFix: Upgrade got library to version 12.0.0-beta.1 or later (11.8.5+ for 11.x branch)
resolutionDetails: The vulnerable dependency was automatically removed or updated in the project, and the issue was auto-closed by Mend when got was no longer part of the dependency inventory.
keyQuote: The got package before 12.1.0 (also fixed in 11.8.5) for Node.js allows a redirect to a UNIX socket.
